SENT.plain: Cytogenetic studies were performed on 117 Tunisian patients with de novo myelodysplastic syndromes (MDS)

According to the French-American-British (FAB) criteria 40 patients presented with refractory anaemia (RA, 34%), eight with refractory anaemia with ringed sideroblasts (RARAS, 7%), 19 with refractory anaemia with excess of blasts (RAEB, 16%), 16 with refractory anaemia with excess of blasts in transformation (RAEB-t, 14%), 18 had chronic myelomonocytic leukaemia (CMML, 15%) and 16 unclassifiable MDS (14%)
Seventy-five were men and forty-two were women
Five were children and 112 were adults with a median age of 58 years
Fifty-five per cent of the patients presented clonal chromosome abnormalities
Rates of abnormality varied from one FAB subtype to the other: 55% in RA, 75% in RARAS, 63% in RAEB, 75% in RAEB-t and 28% in CMML
The most frequent chromosome abnormalities were del(5q) (22 cases), monosomy 7 (12 cases), del(12p) (6 cases), and trisomy 8 (5 cases)
Rare abnormalities were also found: ring of chromosome 12 and trisomy 15
Conventional cytogenetics remains the basic technique in identifying chromosomal abnormalities associated with MDS
